hello I am Nanda a cloud Support

you can troubleshoot issues with
associating the AWS managed Microsoft
Active Directory to your RDS sequel
server instances so let's get started
here's what you can do when you have an
AWS managed Microsoft ad configured for
a AWS account but it doesn't appear
while creating a new Arrius sequel
server instance of and modifying an
existing instance currently the windows
authentication for RDS sequel server
instances is supported only in a V PC
this means that the AWS managed
Microsoft ad must be in the same AWS
region and in the same V PC as the RDS
sequel server instances for the ad to
appear when you create or modify an
instance the ad doesn't appear even if
there is a V PC pairing between two V
pcs let's go through the steps when you
have an existing aureus instance and you
want to check if the directly services
and artists instances are in the same V
PC as you can see I have already signed
in to the AWS management console I will
navigate to the aureus console click on
DB instances choose the RDS instance
that needs to join the active directory
under connectivity you can see the V PC
associated with your aureus instance now
to check if the directory services is
created in the same region and in the
same V PC as the Hardys instance go to
the directory services choose your
directory services that you created
under directory details you can find the
V PC information and make sure that it
matches with the RDS instance if the V
PC is different and if the directory
services is in a different AWS region
than the RDS sequence of instance then
you can't see the ad listed during the
RDS instance creation while creating new
aureus instance make sure that you
select the same V PC as your directory
services then you can see the ad listed
in the Microsoft sequel server windows
authentication list let me show you that
let's go to RDS create database
sequel server choose your desired DB
instance class DB identifier a master
user password click on next
make sure the V PC is same as your
directory services and now you will be
able to see your directory services
create database now here's what you can
do if you have the AWS management of AD
in the same region and in the same V PC
as my Aria sequel server instances note
that you might not see the option to add
the Active Directory while creating a
new audience instance or modifying an

does not support Windows authentication
for artistical server in all the a SS
region this means that you aren't
provided with an option to add Active
Directory to a RDS instance in the
following regions US west north

America Sao Paulo
AWS cloud cloud u.s. East Awl cloud us
West so here's what you can do if you
get this error message when you try join
an RDS instance to a domain for the
aureus instance that has failed to join
a domain rejoin the aureus instance to
the domain from the AWS management
console navigate to the RDS consult page
click on DB instances select the artists
instance which failed to join the domain
modify the aureus instance scroll down
to Microsoft sequel server windows
authentication choose none for directory
and apply the changes immediately when
the modification is complete the RDS
instance automatically reboots this may
take some time as you can see now the
instance is available now to join the
directory modify the Arias instance and
then scroll to Microsoft sequel server
windows authentication for directly
choose your ad from the list and apply
the changes immediately
when the modifications complete the
audience instance automatic reboots this
may take a while if this has not
resolved an issue makes sure that the
inbound and outbound rules are
configured correctly for RDS sequence of
instances to communicate with the active
directory now here's what you can do if
we have associated AWS managed Microsoft
ad to your Arrius instance but you can't

windows authentication to log in using
windows authentication you must create a
sequel login on the RDS sequence or

using the Arias instance master
credential as you can see I am now

login to your arias sequence of instance
